skillTree.name: Great Taurus
skillTree.description: As creatures of flame and ash, the Red Bulls of Hashut cannot stray far from the Dark Lands, save for when the Winds of Magic – and Aqshy specifically – are at their strongest.

skillTree.name: Lammasu
skillTree.description: Believed to be a rare mutation of the Great Taurus, the magical Lammasu are the living embodiment of the Dark Land's rage, exhaling sorcerous clouds to protect their riders.

skillTree.name: Bale Taurus
skillTree.description: Wreathed in smoke, these huge, winged Daemonic-bulls are blessed with flesh that burns with the intensity of a living furnace that sparks the ground 'neath their hooves.

skillTree.name: Unyielding Command
skillTree.description: With a leader this cruel, is it any surprise that his troops are obedient and loyal to the end? Fear is the most effective motivator.

skillTree.name: Careful Casting
skillTree.description: A modicum of care is just common sense when getting it wrong can find you trapped in another, infinitely worse dimension…

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

skillTree.name: Sorcerer's Curse
skillTree.description: By which the foe slowly turns to stone, beginning with the feet, so they are all too aware of their terrible fate as it gradually unfolds.

skillTree.name: Hashut's Scales
skillTree.description: The Father of Darkness protects his children from sorcery through a variety of magical means, all of them twisted and obscure.

skillTree.name: Headdress of Zharr
skillTree.description: Having a thing for hats can be most useful when everyone keeps aiming at your head…

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Thirst for Magic
skillTree.description: Though the price may well be terrible, and it surely is, the Dawi-Zharr's lust for power remains insatiable and unquenchable.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn

skillTree.name: Flesh Sacrifice
skillTree.description: The priests of Hashut make the most horrifying offerings to their grim, malignant deity.

skillTree.name: Voice of Hashut
skillTree.description: When Father speaks of omens ill, his evil children listen intently to his heinous plans.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for centaurs and monsters
	(Lord's army)
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Searing Doom"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Searing Doom Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Searing Doom Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Plague of Rust"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Plague of Rust Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Plague of Rust Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Glittering Robe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Glittering Robe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Glittering Robe Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Gehenna's Golden Hounds"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Gehenna's Golden Hounds Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Gehenna's Golden Hounds Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Transmutation of Lead"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Transmutation of Lead Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Transmutation of Lead Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Final Transmutation"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Final Transmutation Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Final Transmutation Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Survivalist
skillTree.description: "The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."

skillTree.name: Always Ready
skillTree.description: Death is always just a shot away.

skillTree.name: Bandolier
skillTree.description: Professional soldiery means never running out of ammo at the crucial moment.

skillTree.name: Expeditious Endeavour
skillTree.description: What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

skillTree.name: Piercing Shots
skillTree.description: What use armour, or even magical defences, against such powerful ordnance?

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Fervent Fodder
skillTree.description: Though they face almost-certain death at the enemy's hands, that has to be better than what the Chaos Dwarfs have in store for their Greenskin underlings, right? Some even welcome such an end.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders Melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Blackshard Bulwark
skillTree.description: Wearing ultra-resilient armour forged with blood and hellfire, the Chaos Dwarfs present a  mighty defensive wall, stronger even than steel, to their incautious, overconfident enemies.

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +8 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Firing Drills
skillTree.description: Drilling loading, shooting and reloading, until they become second nature, so the foe is under constant barrage, is surely the way to victory.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Hobgoblin Archers, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses, Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders (Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Hellforged Ordnance
skillTree.description: Beneath their mutated faces and ever-darkened souls, the Chaos Dwarfs are still Dwarfs at heart, retaining all of their counterparts' metalworking skill and knack for ingenious engineering solutions.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +6% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Range: +5% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Crushing Charge
skillTree.description: Assuming you can't avoid the confrontation altogether, the most sensible course of action is to get well out of the way!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +4% for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +4 for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Bull Centaur Renders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Hellish Blows
skillTree.description: The Daemonic fire-elementals and various other monstrous creatures in the Chaos Dwarfs' service are fielded to crack the skulls and crush the souls of those who dare stand against them.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +4% for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Lucky Lackeys
skillTree.description: Even though they're considered little more than a raw resource by their evil masters, some Greenskins avoid being worked to death by "assisting" their keepers on the field of battle.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Hobgoblins  and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 10% for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Marshalled Military
skillTree.description: To be this effective in battle takes not just suicidal levels of courage and determination, but the discipline to hold the line and, as one, take the fight directly into the enemy's wavering hearts.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Chaos Dwarf melee infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Bloodied Bombardment
skillTree.description: From the barrels of the Chaos Dwarfs' infernal war machines are fired shrieking rockets and blasts of raw, Ruinous magick, leaving those not instantly turned to liquid quaking and gibbering in their wake.

effects.description:
Explosive Missile Damage: +12% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Iron Daemon, Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Iron Daemon and Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Wretched Warhost
skillTree.description: Those twisted, hellishly-mutated monsters in the service of the Chaos Dwarfs are some of their most effective weapons, particularly when organised into a malign host of Ruinous shock troops.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

skillTree.name: Cunning
skillTree.description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%

skillTree.name: Logistician
skillTree.description: Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ruthless Disciplinarian
skillTree.description: Beatings WILL continue until morale improves, or even if it does...

skillTree.name: Tyrant
skillTree.description: Some conquerors are mild and fair. Not so this one, whose savagery and corruption truly know no bounds.

skillTree.name: Iron-Willed
skillTree.description: A Dawi-Zharr such as he does not care for being wounded – by his will alone he continues to fight.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Alert
skillTree.description: Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Evasion chance when using the Underway: +10%
Evasion chance when using the Underway: +20%

skillTree.name: Despoilers
skillTree.description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them – this is what Chaos wants.

skillTree.name: Serve or Die
skillTree.description: "You will serve me, wretch, or you will die. There is no other option."

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Unbridled Cruelty
skillTree.description: Brutality or viciousness don't go anywhere near far enough. Even barbarism is too mild a term.

backgroundSkills.name: Thirstful
backgroundSkills.description: His throat itches for the sweet taste of enchantment; the golden nectar that is true power.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(Lord's army)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.name: Needful
backgroundSkills.description: His desire for magical power has become an obsession, to the point where he seeks out magic items to exclusion of all else.

backgroundSkills.name: Hateful – Order
backgroundSkills.description: Order, with all of its purity and sickening… goodness, is anathema to this one, and he hates it with a burning passion.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Hateful – Death & Destruction
backgroundSkills.description: Destruction, and Death, its inseparable counterpart, are beyond odious and wicked in this one's eyes, and he will never change his mind on the matter.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven and Ogres, Tomb Kings, Vampire Coast and Vampire Counts
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Vengeful
backgroundSkills.description: Even for a race known for their inability to forget grudges, this one is utterly consumed by every slight, no matter how small, and will always pursue them to the bitter, bloody end.

backgroundSkills.name: Scornful
backgroundSkills.description: More than utterly devoid of fear, this one sneers and scoffs at the foe, no matter how big and how hard they are.

backgroundSkills.name: Cowardly
backgroundSkills.description: There are those who live for battle and risk death at every turn. Not so, this one, who is more than apprehensive when faced with the fray.

backgroundSkills.name: Impulsive
backgroundSkills.description: Some would call them hasty, others dynamic and valiant, for this one acts on impulse, before the enemy have a chance to react.

backgroundSkills.name: Conceited
backgroundSkills.description: There's pride, and then there's self-regarding, narcissistic vainglory. Not a good look.

backgroundSkills.name: Envious
backgroundSkills.description: Whatever you've got is what this one wants, and the more enchanted, the better.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

backgroundSkills.name: Greedy
backgroundSkills.description: Kill them all and keep the loot for yourself. It's not a negative quality to be acquisitive as, after all, it's a material world, no?

backgroundSkills.name: Boastful
backgroundSkills.description: You'd think he was the only one ever to have achieved something, the way he goes on about every little victory.

backgroundSkills.name: Hated
backgroundSkills.description: No one likes him, but he really couldn't care less. He has an extremely thick skin, figuratively and literally, it seems.

backgroundSkills.name: Hubristic
backgroundSkills.description: Pride is supposed to come before a fall, but thus far, this one has not lived up to that proverb.

backgroundSkills.name: Superior
backgroundSkills.description: This one believes themselves to be better than others in every respect, and acts accordingly at every given opportunity.

backgroundSkills.name: Exiled
backgroundSkills.description: Having spent a considerable period banished from their own lands, this one had the time to reflect and improve on their many shortcomings.

backgroundSkills.name: Miserly
backgroundSkills.description: Parsimonious to say the least, this one never wants to shell out on the best that money can buy.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Aggressive
backgroundSkills.description: Get in there, get bloody, get the job done – as soon as possible. Dallying's for losers.

backgroundSkills.name: Overconfident
backgroundSkills.description: I'm not saying this one's heading for a fall, but… well, yes, actually I am saying that.

backgroundSkills.name: Selfish
backgroundSkills.description: Me, me, me, mine, mine, mine – that just about somes up this one's attitude to, well, everything, really.

backgroundSkills.name: Phlegmatic
backgroundSkills.description: Stoic and calm, this one is never anything less than totally in control.

backgroundSkills.name: Choleric
backgroundSkills.description: It should be obvious that literally never being in a good mood is going to make one that little bit more brutal in melee.

backgroundSkills.name: Corrupt
backgroundSkills.description: Backhanders – hell, fronthanders, even, so unscrupulous is he.

backgroundSkills.name: Apathetic
backgroundSkills.description: "Do we have to? Urgh, how tedious…"

backgroundSkills.name: Cruel
backgroundSkills.description: The lives of others mean nothing to this abject psycho, and neither does their property. If it's not nailed down, or even if it is, it's fair game to him.
